Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that every contaminated corpse in New York belongs to the state and will be incinerated without any wakes or memorial services. This is not true as funeral services with limited visitors are allowed and cremation is not mandated.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that funeral services are still allowed in New York with limited participants.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed by any credible evidence or official statements.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all COVID-19 victims in New York will be incinerated without any wakes or memorial services, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents a false alternative explanation for what happens when someone dies from COVID-19 in New York, creating unnecessary alarm and misinformation.
